id: Wigan-bound Shaun Edwards leaves door open to union return as he enters final year with Wales
paragraph:
Shaun Edwards has revealed it will not necessarily be a final goodbye when he leaves rugby union to return to his league roots in a year’s time and has hinted that he would like to come back to Wales in the future.Edwards will take over as head coach of Wigan when Warren Gatland’s reign ends following the World Cup next October and he agrees that the role is now even more tantalising after watching his old side win last weekend’s Grand Final. But before his four-year contract begins, he has unfinished business on the west side of the Severn as Gatland’s defence supremo.“It does feel a little bit strange, to be honest,” he said. “This is my last autumn campaign with Wales, or anyway in this...© Telegraph Media Group Limited 2018We rely on advertising to help fund our award-winning journalism.We urge you to turn off your ad blocker for The Telegraph website so that you can continue to access our quality content in the future.Thank you for your support.Need help?Visit our adblocking instructions
